_AdaptiveError_.description: This is error detail if status is error. This property will not exist for intermediate response objects.
_AdaptiveError_.title: Error

actionNumber.description: If the request has multiple actions, this is the number, starting with 1, of the action that caused the error.
actionNumber.title: Action Index

backtrace.description: The backtrace from where the error occurred.
backtrace.title: Backtrace

backtraceEvaluation.description: The evaluation backtrace from where the error occurred.
backtraceEvaluation.title: Backtrace Expression

column.description: The column in line of the error. This is only available if source contains line breaks.
column.title: Column

data.description: Optional data supplied on the throw.
data.title: Additional

errorSource.description: The internal source filename:line where the error occurred.
errorSource.title: Error Source

id.description: The mnemonic for the numeric error code (errorCode).
id.title: Error Code Id

line.description: The line number in the adaptive value source of the error. This is only available if source contains line breaks.
line.title: Line

offset.description: The offset in the adaptive value source of the error.
offset.title: Offset

parserColumnNumber.description: The column number where the error occurred.
parserColumnNumber.title: Parser Column Number

parserCursor.description: The UTF-8 octet source cursor that the parser at the time the syntax error occurred. This can be used as an offset into parserSource if it is available.
parserCursor.title: Parser Cursor

parserLineNumber.description: The parser cursor's line number where the syntax error occurred.
parserLineNumber.title: Parser Line Number

parserSource.description: This is the source being compiled that was available at the time of the syntax error. This may be the partial source since the compiler sometimes reads source as it is needed.
parserSource.title: Parser Source

sourceFile.description: The c source file where the error was thrown.
sourceFile.title: Source File

sourceLocation.description: This is the source location of the error. This is usually a reference to the adaptive value source location.
sourceLocation.title: Source Location

xctxUUID.description: This is the UUID of the execution context (xctx) when the error occurred. There is normally one xctx per request. This UUID is included by default in log message, which can be useful for finding messages related to a request.
xctxUUID.title: XCTX UUID

console.description: If response:console flag is set and response:console:stream is not set, this will have any output written to console.
console.title: Console

stderr.description: If response:stderr flag is set and response:stderr:stream is not set, this will have any output written to stderr.
stderr.title: Stderr

stdout.description: If response:stdout flag is set and response:stdout:stream is not set, this will have any output written to stdout.
stdout.title: Stdout

actions.description: If the request has multiple actions, this property is an array of _AdaptiveResponseAction_ objects.

items.description: If the request has multiple actions, this property is an array of _AdaptiveResponseAction_ objects.
items.title: List of _AdaptiveResponseAction_ objects

actions.title: Actions

console.description: If response:console flag is set and response:console:stream is not set, this will have any output written to console.
console.title: Console

error.description: This is error detail if status is error. This property will not exist for intermediate response objects.
error.title: Error

intermediate.description: If true, this is an intermediate response object containing a single result that will be followed by at least one more response object. If intermediate is missing or false, this is the final response object.
intermediate.title: Intermediate

result.description: The result if this is a single action request or intermediate response when no error occurred. If the 'actions' property is present, see that list of objects for results.
result.title: Result

status.description: Result status. If this value is 'error', see property 'error' for more detail. This property will not exist for intermediate response objects.
status.title: Status

stderr.description: If response:stderr flag is set and response:stderr:stream is not set, this will have any output written to stderr.
stderr.title: Stderr

stdout.description: If response:stdout flag is set and response:stdout:stream is not set, this will have any output written to stdout.
stdout.title: Stdout
